fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-26527].
  {panel}

To reproduce:
* create a two-column layout
* add some text in one of the columns
* hit undo
* you can no longer move your cursor with the arrow keys...hitting the arrow keys scrolls the page.

This makes the experience pretty unusable.
fields.summary: Page layouts - hitting undo in a multi-column layout freezes the cursor
Add "archive space" to the XML-RPC API
Allow User Edit Permissions on a Page Without Granting them Add Permission
Support SVG
Clear plugin cache after an upgrade / possibly on every startup
Differentiate Disabled User to Inform other User
Links to project wikis from projects drop down menu do not match configured Confluence space
Provide progress indicator during upgrade tasks

Moved from https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-6029

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a new JIRA project.
# Click on the "Wiki" tab.
# Click on "Browse -> Space Admin".
# Click "Remove Space". Wait for the space to be removed.
# Click the "Wiki" tab if it is not selected.
# Select the "Project" dropdown in the upper-left hand corner and select your just-deleted space.
# Observe the following stacktrace:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-26492].
  {panel}

We currently use a cache to store the fact that we have already sent a like notification to a particular person because they follow people in Confluence. 

If another person in that person's network also likes the same page, this cache will prevent another email being sent. 

However, since this cache is local to each node on the cluster, it is not effective against likes on other nodes. 

To fix this, we should use a cluster rather than a node local cache.
fields.summary: Network like notifications are more likely to be sent multiple times on a cluster

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-26472].
  {panel}

A Confluence instance that is not connected to the internet cannot check for plugin updates, or compatibility of plugins with newer versions of Confluence. 

It would be great to have a way for these instances to check for new plugin updates, and to check their plugin compatibility with new Confluence versions.

h4. Workaround
Create a test server with access to the internet, using the data from the live server:
# Set up a test instance with access to the internet, follow the instructions [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrating+Confluence+Between+Servers].
# Go to Confluence Admin > Plugins > Manage Existing, and see which plugins say that they require an update
# Update them in the test system, making a note of which version they have updated to
# Download the plugins manually from marketplace.atlassian.com
# Upload the plugins to the live system
fields.summary: Create a way for a non-internet connected (offline) Confluence instances to check for plugin updates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-26469].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When editing a table in a page, selecting all in a row and pressing {{Delete}} key, only IE browser behaves differently from the other browsers.

h3. Environment

* IE11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a table in a page edit view
# Select all in the row
 !before_delete_win.png|thumbnail! 
# Press {{Backspace}} key (or {{Delete}} key)

h3. Expected Results

All contents in the row should be removed as they were on Chrome and Firefox.
!after_delete_chrome.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Nothing is removed on IE.
 !after_delete_win.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Deleting an entire row from a table in Chrome, Firefox and IE gives different results.
Unable to access the page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-26464].
  {panel}

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Login to JIRA, then copy the Gadget URL for the Created vs Resolved Chart gadget.
# Login to Confluence, then navigate to {{Confluence Admin >> External Gadgets}}.
# Paste the gadget URL there. (Add a new external gadget)
# Create a page in Confluence, and insert the "Created vs Resolved Chart" macro into the page. 
# Make sure that the chart is displayed correctly after saving the page.
# Edit the page again, then edit the Created vs Resolved Chart macro that you inserted earlier.
# Click on the small gear button in the Preview screen, and click *Edit*

You will notice that the right scrollbar in the preview tab is not shown, hence, we are not able to scroll down to click *Save*:
!createdresolved.jpg!

h3.Workaround

The only workaround found at the moment would be to remove the macro and then, re-create it with the new data.
fields.summary: Unable to Edit Created vs Resolved JIRA Gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-26460].
  {panel}

To reproduce:
# create a table
# in one of the cells, add a few bullets.
# get your cursor at the end of the first bullet and keep hitting CMD+Backspace/Delete (or Shift + Home then Delete/Backspace on Windows)

+Expected result+: It will delete every word in the row and eventually delete the bullet and the entire row, moving the rows below it up one line
+Actual result+: It deletes the bullet but not the entire row.

The end result is that you can never delete that first row.

See the video here http://screencast.com/t/FqkvqLFQsnaZ

It seems to be caused by this moz-dirty element?
!https://img.skitch.com/20120807-ex7th6myyj5s8u5887545su4fq.png!
fields.summary: Cannot delete the first bullet in a table cell

Details outside of description:

Create a page in Space B which contains a link to a page in Space A.

The page in the export linking to Space A contains a full href.

Would like a feature when exporting an option to choose unresolved links contain relative path instead of full URL.

Had a customer request this as they use html export to give some spaces to their customers as documentation, but there are existing links in the spaces to other spaces that they don't give to their customers. So if their customer clicks on one of these links, it brings them to a login page for the original customer's Confluence instance.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-26423].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
* Create new page
* Fill with enough content so the screen can scroll several times
* Scroll to the centre and click on a line somewhere in the middle (anywhere except the bottom of the screen will work)
* Start a bullet point by typing: {{* foo}}
* Observe the text box scrolls to make the current line the bottom

Expected behaviour:
No scrolling should occur. Clicking the bullet point button in the toolbar does not cause scrolling. The macro shortcut for starting a bullet point list should behave the same way.


This was tested on EAC and I was able to reproduce it every time.
fields.summary: Using bullet point macro on a large page causes the screen to scroll annoyingly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-26407].
  {panel}

Currently the 'Last Column' option in {viewxls} takes a numeric value, whereas in Excel document by default uses alphabets to designate columns. A value of '0' is Column A, '1' is Column B, etc...

This field allows the user to put in non-numeric values without error, which results no effect. This causes a bit of confusion if the user is not paying attention to the text below the field explaining the numeric value requirement.

Two ways we can improve this feature:
* Keep current functionality, but prevent users from inputting non-numeric values
OR, better yet...
* Allow users to input letters as they appear in Excel
fields.summary: Improve the understanding of the 'Last Column' option in Viewxls macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-26390].
  {panel}

Embedded vimeo links using the widget connector do not play on confluence pages when viewing in Chrome.  This is for Chrome only - Firefox, and Safari have been tested, and the videos play as normal.  All you see on the page, is a link to download the latest version of the flash player (see attached screenshot from customer site).  However, in all test cases the latest version of the flash player was installed.  This was confirmed internally on On Demand test instances.

This problem appears only when Confluence is running behind a proxy over SSL.

*Workaround*

The problem is related to one system using SSL and the other system not. So if your Confluence instance is running behind SSL (as in the case of OnDemand) then ensure your links to youtube videos start with https
fields.summary: Embedded Vimeo Linked Videos do not play in Chrome over HTTPS when using a proxy

When including a page with the html-include macro, that contains CSS (for example www.atlassian.com), Documentation theme footer size increases, covering half of the page.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# check the results

h3. Workaround
Use Adaptavist's [iframe macro|https://www.adaptavist.com/display/AtlassianConfluence/iframe+macro] instead.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-26367].
  {panel}

EDIT
This issue seems to be relevant to all images when using the Word exporter, and all versions of Confluence since the mentioned affected Versions, including OnDemand. Raised priority to Major
EDIT


Icons such as the 'tick' icon in the [Tip macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Tip+Macro] are broken in a Word export.

Steps to reproduce:
# Add a new page.
# Insert a tip using the Tip Macro.
# Save the page. Notice the green 'tick' icon in the tip's header.
# Go to "Tools" -> "Export to Word" and open the resulting *.doc file in Word (Windows or Mac).

Instead of a green tick, the image will be broken. The underlying HTML code shows an {{img src}} with the relative path to the icon, e.g. {{/wiki/images/icons/emoticons/check.png}}, which obviously won't work from a self-contained Word document.
fields.summary: Confluence icons are not viewable in a Word export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-26366].
  {panel}

We have identified and fixed a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability that affect Confluence instances, including publicly available instances (that is, Internet-facing servers). XSS vulnerabilities allow an attacker to embed their own JavaScript into a Confluence page. All supported versions of Confluence are affected.

More details are available in the advisory at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Security+Advisory+2012-09-11

*Patch for versions older than 4.1.9*

Attached is a patch that will fix this XSS issue for versions of Confluence older than 4.1.9. This patch has also been tested against Confluence 3.5.16, and should work for all Confluence 3.5.x releases. However, as with any patch, this should be tested thoroughly first, and initially monitored after being installed in production.

To install:

1. Download the attached zip file
2. Shutdown Confluence
3. Move the zip file <installation-directory>/confluence/WEB-INF/classes
4. Extract the zip file
5. Verify that the file <installation-directory>/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/servlet/ConfluenceVelocityServlet.class exists
6. Restart Confluence for the change to take effect

You can read more about applying patches here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+Patched+Class+Files
fields.summary: Cross Site Scripting Vulnerability

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-26297].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create page A
2. Create page B, a child of A
3. Create page C, a child of B
4. Apply Restrictions (E.g. view restrictions) to A.

So it should look like this:

A <-- restricted 
\|_ B 
\|___C

Now delete page A.

Expected: B and C should remain with in hierarchy with restrictions still applied.

Outcome: Restrictions are moved from B and C

If a parent page with restrictions is deleted, the same restrictions should be applied to the first level of children under the parent that was just deleted. 

Tested and can reproduce in Confluence 4.2.x and 4.3
fields.summary: Deleting a parent page makes all child pages move into the root and any inherited page restrictions are removed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-26296].
  {panel}

A Confluence backed by MS SQL Server can run into deadlocking problems when not using transaction isolation level 'Read Committed with Row Versioning'. This often occurs silently without warning in Confluence logs:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-21986
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-22302
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Database+Deadlock+on+Microsoft+SQL+Server
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/UPM+Cannot+be+Upgraded
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Confluence+Hangs+When+Trying+to+Add+or+Manage+Users


To the observer, the symptom is that the application 'hangs', with or without errors in the Confluence logs. In the case of an upgrade, when observing the logs an upgrade task will be seemingly 'stuck' and refuse to proceed (no errors).

We should check for DB transaction isolation level during start up and print an error/warning in the logs if not using the recommended isolation. We can also go one step further and prevent the application from starting, like we do for MySQL if they're not using READ-COMMITTED.
fields.summary: When using MS SQL Server, Check for 'Read-Committed with Row Versioning' transaction isolation during startup/upgrades
